00203 #define CV_LOG2 0.69314718055994530941723212145818
00204 
00205 #define CV_SWAP(a,b,t) ((t) = (a), (a) = (b), (b) = (t))

00207 #ifndef MIN
00208 #define MIN(a,b)  ((a) > (b) ? (b) : (a))
00209 #endif
00210 
00211 #ifndef MAX
00212 #define MAX(a,b)  ((a) < (b) ? (b) : (a))
00213 #endif

00215 /* min & max without jumps */
00216 #define  CV_IMIN(a, b)  ((a) ^ (((a)^(b)) & (((a) < (b)) - 1)))
00217 
00218 #define  CV_IMAX(a, b)  ((a) ^ (((a)^(b)) & (((a) > (b)) - 1)))
00219 
00220 /* absolute value without jumps */
00221 #ifndef __cplusplus
00222 #define  CV_IABS(a)     (((a) ^ ((a) < 0 ? -1 : 0)) - ((a) < 0 ? -1 : 0))
00223 #else
00224 #define  CV_IABS(a)     abs(a)
00225 #endif
00226 #define  CV_CMP(a,b)    (((a) > (b)) - ((a) < (b)))
00227 #define  CV_SIGN(a)     CV_CMP((a),0)

00229 CV_INLINE  int  cvRound( double value )
00230 {
00231 #if CV_SSE2 && !defined __APPLE__
00232     __m128d t = _mm_set_sd( value );
00233     return _mm_cvtsd_si32(t);
00234 #elif (defined WIN32 || defined _WIN32) && !defined WIN64 && !defined _WIN64 && defined _MSC_VER
00235     int t;
00236     __asm
00237     {
00238         fld value;
00239         fistp t;
00240     }
00241     return t;
00242 #elif defined HAVE_LRINT || defined CV_ICC || defined __GNUC__
00243     return (int)lrint(value);
00244 #else
00245     // while this is not IEEE754-compliant rounding, it's usually a good enough approximation
00246     return (int)(value + 0.5);
00247 #endif
00248 }
00249 
00250 
00251 CV_INLINE  int  cvFloor( double value )
00252 {
00253 #ifdef __GNUC__
00254     int i = (int)value;
00255     return i - (i > value);
00256 #elif CV_SSE2
00257     __m128d t = _mm_set_sd( value );
00258     int i = _mm_cvtsd_si32(t);
00259     return i - _mm_movemask_pd(_mm_cmplt_sd(t, _mm_cvtsi32_sd(t,i)));
00260 #else
00261     int i = cvRound(value);
00262     Cv32suf diff;
00263     diff.f = (float)(value - i);
00264     return i - (diff.i < 0);
00265 #endif
00266 }
00267 
00268 
00269 CV_INLINE  int  cvCeil( double value )
00270 {
00271 #ifdef __GNUC__
00272     int i = (int)value;
00273     return i + (i < value);
00274 #elif CV_SSE2
00275     __m128d t = _mm_set_sd( value );
00276     int i = _mm_cvtsd_si32(t);
00277     return i + _mm_movemask_pd(_mm_cmplt_sd(_mm_cvtsi32_sd(t,i), t));
00278 #else
00279     int i = cvRound(value);
00280     Cv32suf diff;
00281     diff.f = (float)(i - value);
00282     return i + (diff.i < 0);
00283 #endif
00284 }
00285 
00286 #define cvInvSqrt(value) ((float)(1./sqrt(value)))
00287 #define cvSqrt(value)  ((float)sqrt(value))
00288 
00289 CV_INLINE int cvIsNaN( double value )
00290 {
00291 #if 1/*defined _MSC_VER || defined __BORLANDC__
00292     return _isnan(value);
00293 #elif defined __GNUC__
00294     return isnan(value);
00295 #else*/
00296     Cv64suf ieee754;
00297     ieee754.f = value;
00298     return ((unsigned)(ieee754.u >> 32) & 0x7fffffff) +
00299            ((unsigned)ieee754.u != 0) > 0x7ff00000;
00300 #endif
00301 }
00302 
00303 
00304 CV_INLINE int cvIsInf( double value )
00305 {
00306 #if 1/*defined _MSC_VER || defined __BORLANDC__
00307     return !_finite(value);
00308 #elif defined __GNUC__
00309     return isinf(value);
00310 #else*/
00311     Cv64suf ieee754;
00312     ieee754.f = value;
00313     return ((unsigned)(ieee754.u >> 32) & 0x7fffffff) == 0x7ff00000 &&
00314            (unsigned)ieee754.u == 0;
00315 #endif
00316 }

00319 /*************** Random number generation *******************/
00320 
00321 typedef uint64 CvRNG;
00322 
00323 CV_INLINE CvRNG cvRNG( int64 seed CV_DEFAULT(-1))
00324 {
00325     CvRNG rng = seed ? (uint64)seed : (uint64)(int64)-1;
00326     return rng;
00327 }
00328 
00329 /* Return random 32-bit unsigned integer: */
00330 CV_INLINE unsigned cvRandInt( CvRNG* rng )
00331 {
00332     uint64 temp = *rng;
00333     temp = (uint64)(unsigned)temp*4164903690U + (temp >> 32);
00334     *rng = temp;
00335     return (unsigned)temp;
00336 }
00337 
00338 /* Returns random floating-point number between 0 and 1: */
00339 CV_INLINE double cvRandReal( CvRNG* rng )
00340 {
00341     return cvRandInt(rng)*2.3283064365386962890625e-10 /* 2^-32 */;
00342 }

00385 typedef struct _IplImage
00386 {
00387     int  nSize;             /* sizeof(IplImage) */
00388     int  ID;                /* version (=0)*/
00389     int  nChannels;         /* Most of OpenCV functions support 1,2,3 or 4 channels */
00390     int  alphaChannel;      /* Ignored by OpenCV */
00391     int  depth;             /* Pixel depth in bits: IPL_DEPTH_8U, IPL_DEPTH_8S, IPL_DEPTH_16S,
00392                                IPL_DEPTH_32S, IPL_DEPTH_32F and IPL_DEPTH_64F are supported.  */
00393     char colorModel[4];     /* Ignored by OpenCV */
00394     char channelSeq[4];     /* ditto */
00395     int  dataOrder;         /* 0 - interleaved color channels, 1 - separate color channels.
00396                                cvCreateImage can only create interleaved images */
00397     int  origin;            /* 0 - top-left origin,
00398                                1 - bottom-left origin (Windows bitmaps style).  */
00399     int  align;             /* Alignment of image rows (4 or 8).
00400                                OpenCV ignores it and uses widthStep instead.    */
00401     int  width;             /* Image width in pixels.                           */
00402     int  height;            /* Image height in pixels.                          */
00403     struct _IplROI *roi;    /* Image ROI. If NULL, the whole image is selected. */
00404     struct _IplImage *maskROI;      /* Must be NULL. */
00405     void  *imageId;                 /* "           " */
00406     struct _IplTileInfo *tileInfo;  /* "           " */
00407     int  imageSize;         /* Image data size in bytes
00408                                (==image->height*image->widthStep
00409                                in case of interleaved data)*/
00410     char *imageData;        /* Pointer to aligned image data.         */
00411     int  widthStep;         /* Size of aligned image row in bytes.    */
00412     int  BorderMode[4];     /* Ignored by OpenCV.                     */
00413     int  BorderConst[4];    /* Ditto.                                 */
00414     char *imageDataOrigin;  /* Pointer to very origin of image data
00415                                (not necessarily aligned) -
00416                                needed for correct deallocation */
00417 }

00616 #define CV_IS_MAT_HDR(mat) \
00617     ((mat) != NULL && \
00618     (((const CvMat*)(mat))->type & CV_MAGIC_MASK) == CV_MAT_MAGIC_VAL && \
00619     ((const CvMat*)(mat))->cols > 0 && ((const CvMat*)(mat))->rows > 0)
00620 
00621 #define CV_IS_MAT(mat) \
00622     (CV_IS_MAT_HDR(mat) && ((const CvMat*)(mat))->data.ptr != NULL)
00623 
00624 #define CV_IS_MASK_ARR(mat) \
00625     (((mat)->type & (CV_MAT_TYPE_MASK & ~CV_8SC1)) == 0)
00626 
00627 #define CV_ARE_TYPES_EQ(mat1, mat2) \
00628     ((((mat1)->type ^ (mat2)->type) & CV_MAT_TYPE_MASK) == 0)
00629 
00630 #define CV_ARE_CNS_EQ(mat1, mat2) \
00631     ((((mat1)->type ^ (mat2)->type) & CV_MAT_CN_MASK) == 0)
00632 
00633 #define CV_ARE_DEPTHS_EQ(mat1, mat2) \
00634     ((((mat1)->type ^ (mat2)->type) & CV_MAT_DEPTH_MASK) == 0)
00635 
00636 #define CV_ARE_SIZES_EQ(mat1, mat2) \
00637     ((mat1)->rows == (mat2)->rows && (mat1)->cols == (mat2)->cols)
00638 
00639 #define CV_IS_MAT_CONST(mat)  \
00640     (((mat)->rows|(mat)->cols) == 1)
00641 
00642 /* Size of each channel item,
00643    0x124489 = 1000 0100 0100 0010 0010 0001 0001 ~ array of sizeof(arr_type_elem) */
00644 #define CV_ELEM_SIZE1(type) \
00645     ((((sizeof(size_t)<<28)|0x8442211) >> CV_MAT_DEPTH(type)*4) & 15)
00646 
00647 /* 0x3a50 = 11 10 10 01 01 00 00 ~ array of log2(sizeof(arr_type_elem)) */
00648 #define CV_ELEM_SIZE(type) \
00649     (CV_MAT_CN(type) << ((((sizeof(size_t)/4+1)*16384|0x3a50) >> CV_MAT_DEPTH(type)*2) & 3))
00650 
00651 #define IPL2CV_DEPTH(depth) \
00652     ((((CV_8U)+(CV_16U<<4)+(CV_32F<<8)+(CV_64F<<16)+(CV_8S<<20)+ \
00653     (CV_16S<<24)+(CV_32S<<28)) >> ((((depth) & 0xF0) >> 2) + \
00654     (((depth) & IPL_DEPTH_SIGN) ? 20 : 0))) & 15)
00655 
00656 /* Inline constructor. No data is allocated internally!!!
00657  * (Use together with cvCreateData, or use cvCreateMat instead to
00658  * get a matrix with allocated data):
00659  */
00660 CV_INLINE CvMat cvMat( int rows, int cols, int type, void* data CV_DEFAULT(NULL))
00661 {
00662     CvMat m;
00663 
00664     assert( (unsigned)CV_MAT_DEPTH(type) <= CV_64F );
00665     type = CV_MAT_TYPE(type);
00666     m.type = CV_MAT_MAGIC_VAL | CV_MAT_CONT_FLAG | type;
00667     m.cols = cols;
00668     m.rows = rows;
00669     m.step = m.cols*CV_ELEM_SIZE(type);
00670     m.data.ptr = (uchar*)data;
00671     m.refcount = NULL;
00672     m.hdr_refcount = 0;
00673 
00674     return m;
00675 }
00676 
00677 
00678 #define CV_MAT_ELEM_PTR_FAST( mat, row, col, pix_size )  \
00679     (assert( (unsigned)(row) < (unsigned)(mat).rows &&   \
00680              (unsigned)(col) < (unsigned)(mat).cols ),   \
00681      (mat).data.ptr + (size_t)(mat).step*(row) + (pix_size)*(col))
00682 
00683 #define CV_MAT_ELEM_PTR( mat, row, col )                 \
00684     CV_MAT_ELEM_PTR_FAST( mat, row, col, CV_ELEM_SIZE((mat).type) )
00685 
00686 #define CV_MAT_ELEM( mat, elemtype, row, col )           \
00687     (*(elemtype*)CV_MAT_ELEM_PTR_FAST( mat, row, col, sizeof(elemtype)))
00688 
00689 
00690 CV_INLINE  double  cvmGet( const CvMat* mat, int row, int col )
00691 {
00692     int type;
00693 
00694     type = CV_MAT_TYPE(mat->type);
00695     assert( (unsigned)row < (unsigned)mat->rows &&
00696             (unsigned)col < (unsigned)mat->cols );
00697 
00698     if( type == CV_32FC1 )
00699         return ((float*)(mat->data.ptr + (size_t)mat->step*row))[col];
00700     else
00701     {
00702         assert( type == CV_64FC1 );
00703         return ((double*)(mat->data.ptr + (size_t)mat->step*row))[col];
00704     }
00705 }
00706 
00707 
00708 CV_INLINE  void  cvmSet( CvMat* mat, int row, int col, double value )
00709 {
00710     int type;
00711     type = CV_MAT_TYPE(mat->type);
00712     assert( (unsigned)row < (unsigned)mat->rows &&
00713             (unsigned)col < (unsigned)mat->cols );
00714 
00715     if( type == CV_32FC1 )
00716         ((float*)(mat->data.ptr + (size_t)mat->step*row))[col] = (float)value;
00717     else
00718     {
00719         assert( type == CV_64FC1 );
00720         ((double*)(mat->data.ptr + (size_t)mat->step*row))[col] = (double)value;
00721     }
00722 }
00723 
00724 
00725 CV_INLINE int cvIplDepth( int type )
00726 {
00727     int depth = CV_MAT_DEPTH(type);
00728     return CV_ELEM_SIZE1(depth)*8 | (depth == CV_8S || depth == CV_16S ||
00729            depth == CV_32S ? IPL_DEPTH_SIGN : 0);
00730 }
00731

00751     union
00752     {
00753         uchar* ptr;
00754         float* fl;
00755         double* db;
00756         int* i;
00757         short* s;
00758     } data;
00759

00761     {
00762         int size;
00763         int step;
00764     }

00766 }

00833 
00834 #define CV_HIST_MAGIC_VAL     0x42450000
00835 #define CV_HIST_UNIFORM_FLAG  (1 << 10)
00836 
00837 /* indicates whether bin ranges are set already or not */
00838 #define CV_HIST_RANGES_FLAG   (1 << 11)
00839 
00840 #define CV_HIST_ARRAY         0

00842 #define CV_HIST_TREE          CV_HIST_SPARSE

00845    it turns to CV_HIST_UNIFORM_FLAG of hist->type */
00846 #define CV_HIST_UNIFORM       1
00847 
00848 typedef struct CvHistogram
00849 {
00850     int     type;
00851     CvArr*  bins;
00852     float   thresh[CV_MAX_DIM][2];  /* For uniform histograms.                      */
00853     float** thresh2;                /* For non-uniform histograms.                  */
00854     CvMatND mat;                    /* Embedded matrix header for array histograms. */
00855 }
00856 CvHistogram;
00857 
00858 #define CV_IS_HIST( hist ) \
00859     ((hist) != NULL  && \
00860      (((CvHistogram*)(hist))->type & CV_MAGIC_MASK) == CV_HIST_MAGIC_VAL && \
00861      (hist)->bins != NULL)
00862 
00863 #define CV_IS_UNIFORM_HIST( hist ) \
00864     (((hist)->type & CV_HIST_UNIFORM_FLAG) != 0)
00865 
00866 #define CV_IS_SPARSE_HIST( hist ) \
00867     CV_IS_SPARSE_MAT((hist)->bins)
00868 
00869 #define CV_HIST_HAS_RANGES( hist ) \
00870     (((hist)->type & CV_HIST_RANGES_FLAG) != 0)

01188 /******************************** Memory storage ****************************************/
01189 
01190 typedef struct CvMemBlock
01191 {
01192     struct CvMemBlock*  prev;
01193     struct CvMemBlock*  next;
01194 }
01195 CvMemBlock;
01196 
01197 #define CV_STORAGE_MAGIC_VAL    0x42890000
01198 
01199 typedef struct CvMemStorage
01200 {
01201     int signature;
01202     CvMemBlock* bottom;           /* First allocated block.                   */
01203     CvMemBlock* top;              /* Current memory block - top of the stack. */
01204     struct  CvMemStorage* parent; /* We get new blocks from parent as needed. */
01205     int block_size;               /* Block size.                              */
01206     int free_space;               /* Remaining free space in current block.   */
01207 }
01208 CvMemStorage;
01209 
01210 #define CV_IS_STORAGE(storage)  \
01211     ((storage) != NULL &&       \
01212     (((CvMemStorage*)(storage))->signature & CV_MAGIC_MASK) == CV_STORAGE_MAGIC_VAL)
01213

01222 
01223 /*********************************** Sequence *******************************************/
01224 
01225 typedef struct CvSeqBlock
01226 {
01227     struct CvSeqBlock*  prev; /* Previous sequence block.                   */
01228     struct CvSeqBlock*  next; /* Next sequence block.                       */
01229   int    start_index;         /* Index of the first element in the block +  */
01230                               /* sequence->first->start_index.              */
01231     int    count;             /* Number of elements in the block.           */
01232     schar* data;              /* Pointer to the first element of the block. */
01233 }
01234 CvSeqBlock;
01235 
01236 
01237 #define CV_TREE_NODE_FIELDS(node_type)                               \
01238     int       flags;             /* Miscellaneous flags.     */      \
01239     int       header_size;       /* Size of sequence header. */      \
01240     struct    node_type* h_prev; /* Previous sequence.       */      \
01241     struct    node_type* h_next; /* Next sequence.           */      \
01242     struct    node_type* v_prev; /* 2nd previous sequence.   */      \
01243     struct    node_type* v_next  /* 2nd next sequence.       */
01244 
01245 /*
01246    Read/Write sequence.
01247    Elements can be dynamically inserted to or deleted from the sequence.
01248 */
01249 #define CV_SEQUENCE_FIELDS()                                              \
01250     CV_TREE_NODE_FIELDS(CvSeq);                                           \
01251     int       total;          /* Total number of elements.            */  \
01252     int       elem_size;      /* Size of sequence element in bytes.   */  \
01253     schar*    block_max;      /* Maximal bound of the last block.     */  \
01254     schar*    ptr;            /* Current write pointer.               */  \
01255     int       delta_elems;    /* Grow seq this many at a time.        */  \
01256     CvMemStorage* storage;    /* Where the seq is stored.             */  \
01257     CvSeqBlock* free_blocks;  /* Free blocks list.                    */  \
01258     CvSeqBlock* first;        /* Pointer to the first sequence block. */
01259 
01260 typedef struct CvSeq
01261 {
01262     CV_SEQUENCE_FIELDS()
01263 }
01264 CvSeq;
01265 
01266 #define CV_TYPE_NAME_SEQ             "opencv-sequence"
01267 #define CV_TYPE_NAME_SEQ_TREE        "opencv-sequence-tree"
01268 
01269 /*************************************** Set ********************************************/
01270 /*
01271   Set.
01272   Order is not preserved. There can be gaps between sequence elements.
01273   After the element has been inserted it stays in the same place all the time.
01274   The MSB(most-significant or sign bit) of the first field (flags) is 0 iff the element exists.
01275 */
01276 #define CV_SET_ELEM_FIELDS(elem_type)   \
01277     int  flags;                         \
01278     struct elem_type* next_free;
01279 
01280 typedef struct CvSetElem
01281 {
01282     CV_SET_ELEM_FIELDS(CvSetElem)
01283 }
01284 CvSetElem;
01285 
01286 #define CV_SET_FIELDS()      \
01287     CV_SEQUENCE_FIELDS()     \
01288     CvSetElem* free_elems;   \
01289     int active_count;
01290 
01291 typedef struct CvSet
01292 {
01293     CV_SET_FIELDS()
01294 }
01295 CvSet;
01296 
01297 
01298 #define CV_SET_ELEM_IDX_MASK   ((1 << 26) - 1)
01299 #define CV_SET_ELEM_FREE_FLAG  (1 << (sizeof(int)*8-1))
01300 
01301 /* Checks whether the element pointed by ptr belongs to a set or not */
01302 #define CV_IS_SET_ELEM( ptr )  (((CvSetElem*)(ptr))->flags >= 0)
01303 
01304 /************************************* Graph ********************************************/
01305 
01306 /*
01307   We represent a graph as a set of vertices.
01308   Vertices contain their adjacency lists (more exactly, pointers to first incoming or
01309   outcoming edge (or 0 if isolated vertex)). Edges are stored in another set.
01310   There is a singly-linked list of incoming/outcoming edges for each vertex.
01311 
01312   Each edge consists of
01313 
01314      o   Two pointers to the starting and ending vertices
01315          (vtx[0] and vtx[1] respectively).
01316 
01317          A graph may be oriented or not. In the latter case, edges between
01318          vertex i to vertex j are not distinguished during search operations.
01319 
01320      o   Two pointers to next edges for the starting and ending vertices, where
01321          next[0] points to the next edge in the vtx[0] adjacency list and
01322          next[1] points to the next edge in the vtx[1] adjacency list.
01323 */
01324 #define CV_GRAPH_EDGE_FIELDS()      \
01325     int flags;                      \
01326     float weight;                   \
01327     struct CvGraphEdge* next[2];    \
01328     struct CvGraphVtx* vtx[2];
01329 
01330 
01331 #define CV_GRAPH_VERTEX_FIELDS()    \
01332     int flags;                      \
01333     struct CvGraphEdge* first;
01334 
01335 
01336 typedef struct CvGraphEdge
01337 {
01338     CV_GRAPH_EDGE_FIELDS()
01339 }
01340 CvGraphEdge;
01341 
01342 typedef struct CvGraphVtx
01343 {
01344     CV_GRAPH_VERTEX_FIELDS()
01345 }
01346 CvGraphVtx;

01349 {
01350     CV_GRAPH_VERTEX_FIELDS()
01351     CvPoint2D32f* ptr;
01352 }
01353 CvGraphVtx2D;

01356    Graph is "derived" from the set (this is set a of vertices)
01357    and includes another set (edges)
01358 */
01359 #define  CV_GRAPH_FIELDS()   \
01360     CV_SET_FIELDS()          \
01361     CvSet* edges;

01394 /****************************************************************************************\
01395 *                                    Sequence types                                      *
01396 \****************************************************************************************/
01397 
01398 #define CV_SEQ_MAGIC_VAL             0x42990000
01399 
01400 #define CV_IS_SEQ(seq) \
01401     ((seq) != NULL && (((CvSeq*)(seq))->flags & CV_MAGIC_MASK) == CV_SEQ_MAGIC_VAL)
01402 
01403 #define CV_SET_MAGIC_VAL             0x42980000
01404 #define CV_IS_SET(set) \
01405     ((set) != NULL && (((CvSeq*)(set))->flags & CV_MAGIC_MASK) == CV_SET_MAGIC_VAL)
01406 
01407 #define CV_SEQ_ELTYPE_BITS           9
01408 #define CV_SEQ_ELTYPE_MASK           ((1 << CV_SEQ_ELTYPE_BITS) - 1)
01409 
01410 #define CV_SEQ_ELTYPE_POINT          CV_32SC2  /* (x,y) */
01411 #define CV_SEQ_ELTYPE_CODE           CV_8UC1   /* freeman code: 0..7 */
01412 #define CV_SEQ_ELTYPE_GENERIC        0
01413 #define CV_SEQ_ELTYPE_PTR            CV_USRTYPE1
01414 #define CV_SEQ_ELTYPE_PPOINT         CV_SEQ_ELTYPE_PTR  /* &(x,y) */
01415 #define CV_SEQ_ELTYPE_INDEX          CV_32SC1  /* #(x,y) */
01416 #define CV_SEQ_ELTYPE_GRAPH_EDGE     0  /* &next_o, &next_d, &vtx_o, &vtx_d */
01417 #define CV_SEQ_ELTYPE_GRAPH_VERTEX   0  /* first_edge, &(x,y) */
01418 #define CV_SEQ_ELTYPE_TRIAN_ATR      0  /* vertex of the binary tree   */
01419 #define CV_SEQ_ELTYPE_CONNECTED_COMP 0  /* connected component  */
01420 #define CV_SEQ_ELTYPE_POINT3D        CV_32FC3  /* (x,y,z)  */
01421 
01422 #define CV_SEQ_KIND_BITS        3
01423 #define CV_SEQ_KIND_MASK        (((1 << CV_SEQ_KIND_BITS) - 1)<<CV_SEQ_ELTYPE_BITS)
01424 
01425 /* types of sequences */
01426 #define CV_SEQ_KIND_GENERIC     (0 << CV_SEQ_ELTYPE_BITS)
01427 #define CV_SEQ_KIND_CURVE       (1 << CV_SEQ_ELTYPE_BITS)
01428 #define CV_SEQ_KIND_BIN_TREE    (2 << CV_SEQ_ELTYPE_BITS)
01429 
01430 /* types of sparse sequences (sets) */
01431 #define CV_SEQ_KIND_GRAPH       (3 << CV_SEQ_ELTYPE_BITS)
01432 #define CV_SEQ_KIND_SUBDIV2D    (4 << CV_SEQ_ELTYPE_BITS)
01433 
01434 #define CV_SEQ_FLAG_SHIFT       (CV_SEQ_KIND_BITS + CV_SEQ_ELTYPE_BITS)
01435 
01436 /* flags for curves */
01437 #define CV_SEQ_FLAG_CLOSED     (1 << CV_SEQ_FLAG_SHIFT)
01438 #define CV_SEQ_FLAG_SIMPLE     (2 << CV_SEQ_FLAG_SHIFT)
01439 #define CV_SEQ_FLAG_CONVEX     (4 << CV_SEQ_FLAG_SHIFT)
01440 #define CV_SEQ_FLAG_HOLE       (8 << CV_SEQ_FLAG_SHIFT)
01441 
01442 /* flags for graphs */
01443 #define CV_GRAPH_FLAG_ORIENTED (1 << CV_SEQ_FLAG_SHIFT)
01444 
01445 #define CV_GRAPH               CV_SEQ_KIND_GRAPH
01446 #define CV_ORIENTED_GRAPH      (CV_SEQ_KIND_GRAPH|CV_GRAPH_FLAG_ORIENTED)
01447 
01448 /* point sets */
01449 #define CV_SEQ_POINT_SET       (CV_SEQ_KIND_GENERIC| CV_SEQ_ELTYPE_POINT)
01450 #define CV_SEQ_POINT3D_SET     (CV_SEQ_KIND_GENERIC| CV_SEQ_ELTYPE_POINT3D)
01451 #define CV_SEQ_POLYLINE        (CV_SEQ_KIND_CURVE  | CV_SEQ_ELTYPE_POINT)
01452 #define CV_SEQ_POLYGON         (CV_SEQ_FLAG_CLOSED | CV_SEQ_POLYLINE )
01453 #define CV_SEQ_CONTOUR         CV_SEQ_POLYGON
01454 #define CV_SEQ_SIMPLE_POLYGON  (CV_SEQ_FLAG_SIMPLE | CV_SEQ_POLYGON  )
01455 
01456 /* chain-coded curves */
01457 #define CV_SEQ_CHAIN           (CV_SEQ_KIND_CURVE  | CV_SEQ_ELTYPE_CODE)
01458 #define CV_SEQ_CHAIN_CONTOUR   (CV_SEQ_FLAG_CLOSED | CV_SEQ_CHAIN)
01459 
01460 /* binary tree for the contour */
01461 #define CV_SEQ_POLYGON_TREE    (CV_SEQ_KIND_BIN_TREE  | CV_SEQ_ELTYPE_TRIAN_ATR)
01462 
01463 /* sequence of the connected components */
01464 #define CV_SEQ_CONNECTED_COMP  (CV_SEQ_KIND_GENERIC  | CV_SEQ_ELTYPE_CONNECTED_COMP)
01465 
01466 /* sequence of the integer numbers */
01467 #define CV_SEQ_INDEX           (CV_SEQ_KIND_GENERIC  | CV_SEQ_ELTYPE_INDEX)
01468 
01469 #define CV_SEQ_ELTYPE( seq )   ((seq)->flags & CV_SEQ_ELTYPE_MASK)
01470 #define CV_SEQ_KIND( seq )     ((seq)->flags & CV_SEQ_KIND_MASK )
01471 
01472 /* flag checking */
01473 #define CV_IS_SEQ_INDEX( seq )      ((CV_SEQ_ELTYPE(seq) == CV_SEQ_ELTYPE_INDEX) && \
01474                                      (CV_SEQ_KIND(seq) == CV_SEQ_KIND_GENERIC))
01475 
01476 #define CV_IS_SEQ_CURVE( seq )      (CV_SEQ_KIND(seq) == CV_SEQ_KIND_CURVE)
01477 #define CV_IS_SEQ_CLOSED( seq )     (((seq)->flags & CV_SEQ_FLAG_CLOSED) != 0)
01478 #define CV_IS_SEQ_CONVEX( seq )     (((seq)->flags & CV_SEQ_FLAG_CONVEX) != 0)
01479 #define CV_IS_SEQ_HOLE( seq )       (((seq)->flags & CV_SEQ_FLAG_HOLE) != 0)
01480 #define CV_IS_SEQ_SIMPLE( seq )     ((((seq)->flags & CV_SEQ_FLAG_SIMPLE) != 0) || \
01481                                     CV_IS_SEQ_CONVEX(seq))
01482 
01483 /* type checking macros */
01484 #define CV_IS_SEQ_POINT_SET( seq ) \
01485     ((CV_SEQ_ELTYPE(seq) == CV_32SC2 || CV_SEQ_ELTYPE(seq) == CV_32FC2))
01486 
01487 #define CV_IS_SEQ_POINT_SUBSET( seq ) \
01488     (CV_IS_SEQ_INDEX( seq ) || CV_SEQ_ELTYPE(seq) == CV_SEQ_ELTYPE_PPOINT)
01489 
01490 #define CV_IS_SEQ_POLYLINE( seq )   \
01491     (CV_SEQ_KIND(seq) == CV_SEQ_KIND_CURVE && CV_IS_SEQ_POINT_SET(seq))
01492 
01493 #define CV_IS_SEQ_POLYGON( seq )   \
01494     (CV_IS_SEQ_POLYLINE(seq) && CV_IS_SEQ_CLOSED(seq))
01495 
01496 #define CV_IS_SEQ_CHAIN( seq )   \
01497     (CV_SEQ_KIND(seq) == CV_SEQ_KIND_CURVE && (seq)->elem_size == 1)
01498 
01499 #define CV_IS_SEQ_CONTOUR( seq )   \
01500     (CV_IS_SEQ_CLOSED(seq) && (CV_IS_SEQ_POLYLINE(seq) || CV_IS_SEQ_CHAIN(seq)))
01501 
01502 #define CV_IS_SEQ_CHAIN_CONTOUR( seq ) \
01503     (CV_IS_SEQ_CHAIN( seq ) && CV_IS_SEQ_CLOSED( seq ))
01504 
01505 #define CV_IS_SEQ_POLYGON_TREE( seq ) \
01506     (CV_SEQ_ELTYPE (seq) ==  CV_SEQ_ELTYPE_TRIAN_ATR &&    \
01507     CV_SEQ_KIND( seq ) ==  CV_SEQ_KIND_BIN_TREE )
01508 
01509 #define CV_IS_GRAPH( seq )    \
01510     (CV_IS_SET(seq) && CV_SEQ_KIND((CvSet*)(seq)) == CV_SEQ_KIND_GRAPH)
01511 
01512 #define CV_IS_GRAPH_ORIENTED( seq )   \
01513     (((seq)->flags & CV_GRAPH_FLAG_ORIENTED) != 0)
01514 
01515 #define CV_IS_SUBDIV2D( seq )  \
01516     (CV_IS_SET(seq) && CV_SEQ_KIND((CvSet*)(seq)) == CV_SEQ_KIND_SUBDIV2D)
01517

01525     CvSeqBlock*  block;      /* current block */                   \
01526     schar*       ptr;        /* pointer to free space */           \
01527     schar*       block_min;  /* pointer to the beginning of block*/\
01528     schar*       block_max;  /* pointer to the end of block */

01533 }

01537 #define CV_SEQ_READER_FIELDS()                                      \
01538     int          header_size;                                       \
01539     CvSeq*       seq;        /* sequence, beign read */             \
01540     CvSeqBlock*  block;      /* current block */                    \
01541     schar*       ptr;        /* pointer to element be read next */  \
01542     schar*       block_min;  /* pointer to the beginning of block */\
01543     schar*       block_max;  /* pointer to the end of block */      \
01544     int          delta_index;/* = seq->first->start_index   */      \
01545     schar*       prev_elem;  /* pointer to previous element */

01551 }
01552 CvSeqReader;
01553 
01554 /****************************************************************************************/
01555 /*                                Operations on sequences                               */
01556 /****************************************************************************************/
01557 
01558 #define  CV_SEQ_ELEM( seq, elem_type, index )                    \
01559 /* assert gives some guarantee that <seq> parameter is valid */  \
01560 (   assert(sizeof((seq)->first[0]) == sizeof(CvSeqBlock) &&      \
01561     (seq)->elem_size == sizeof(elem_type)),                      \
01562     (elem_type*)((seq)->first && (unsigned)index <               \
01563     (unsigned)((seq)->first->count) ?                            \
01564     (seq)->first->data + (index) * sizeof(elem_type) :           \
01565     cvGetSeqElem( (CvSeq*)(seq), (index) )))
01566 #define CV_GET_SEQ_ELEM( elem_type, seq, index ) CV_SEQ_ELEM( (seq), elem_type, (index) )
01567 
01568 /* Add element to sequence: */
01569 #define CV_WRITE_SEQ_ELEM_VAR( elem_ptr, writer )     \
01570 {                                                     \
01571     if( (writer).ptr >= (writer).block_max )          \
01572     {                                                 \
01573         cvCreateSeqBlock( &writer);                   \
01574     }                                                 \
01575     memcpy((writer).ptr, elem_ptr, (writer).seq->elem_size);\
01576     (writer).ptr += (writer).seq->elem_size;          \
01577 }
01578 
01579 #define CV_WRITE_SEQ_ELEM( elem, writer )             \
01580 {                                                     \
01581     assert( (writer).seq->elem_size == sizeof(elem)); \
01582     if( (writer).ptr >= (writer).block_max )          \
01583     {                                                 \
01584         cvCreateSeqBlock( &writer);                   \
01585     }                                                 \
01586     assert( (writer).ptr <= (writer).block_max - sizeof(elem));\
01587     memcpy((writer).ptr, &(elem), sizeof(elem));      \
01588     (writer).ptr += sizeof(elem);                     \
01589 }
01590 
01591 
01592 /* Move reader position forward: */
01593 #define CV_NEXT_SEQ_ELEM( elem_size, reader )                 \
01594 {                                                             \
01595     if( ((reader).ptr += (elem_size)) >= (reader).block_max ) \
01596     {                                                         \
01597         cvChangeSeqBlock( &(reader), 1 );                     \
01598     }                                                         \
01599 }
01600 
01601 
01602 /* Move reader position backward: */
01603 #define CV_PREV_SEQ_ELEM( elem_size, reader )                \
01604 {                                                            \
01605     if( ((reader).ptr -= (elem_size)) < (reader).block_min ) \
01606     {                                                        \
01607         cvChangeSeqBlock( &(reader), -1 );                   \
01608     }                                                        \
01609 }
01610 
01611 /* Read element and move read position forward: */
01612 #define CV_READ_SEQ_ELEM( elem, reader )                       \
01613 {                                                              \
01614     assert( (reader).seq->elem_size == sizeof(elem));          \
01615     memcpy( &(elem), (reader).ptr, sizeof((elem)));            \
01616     CV_NEXT_SEQ_ELEM( sizeof(elem), reader )                   \
01617 }
01618 
01619 /* Read element and move read position backward: */
01620 #define CV_REV_READ_SEQ_ELEM( elem, reader )                     \
01621 {                                                                \
01622     assert( (reader).seq->elem_size == sizeof(elem));            \
01623     memcpy(&(elem), (reader).ptr, sizeof((elem)));               \
01624     CV_PREV_SEQ_ELEM( sizeof(elem), reader )                     \
01625 }
01626 
01627 
01628 #define CV_READ_CHAIN_POINT( _pt, reader )                              \
01629 {                                                                       \
01630     (_pt) = (reader).pt;                                                \
01631     if( (reader).ptr )                                                  \
01632     {                                                                   \
01633         CV_READ_SEQ_ELEM( (reader).code, (reader));                     \
01634         assert( ((reader).code & ~7) == 0 );                            \
01635         (reader).pt.x += (reader).deltas[(int)(reader).code][0];        \
01636         (reader).pt.y += (reader).deltas[(int)(reader).code][1];        \
01637     }                                                                   \
01638 }
01639 
01640 #define CV_CURRENT_POINT( reader )  (*((CvPoint*)((reader).ptr)))
01641 #define CV_PREV_POINT( reader )     (*((CvPoint*)((reader).prev_elem)))
01642 
01643 #define CV_READ_EDGE( pt1, pt2, reader )               \
01644 {                                                      \
01645     assert( sizeof(pt1) == sizeof(CvPoint) &&          \
01646             sizeof(pt2) == sizeof(CvPoint) &&          \
01647             reader.seq->elem_size == sizeof(CvPoint)); \
01648     (pt1) = CV_PREV_POINT( reader );                   \
01649     (pt2) = CV_CURRENT_POINT( reader );                \
01650     (reader).prev_elem = (reader).ptr;                 \
01651     CV_NEXT_SEQ_ELEM( sizeof(CvPoint), (reader));      \
01652 }
01653 
01654 /************ Graph macros ************/
01655 
01656 /* Return next graph edge for given vertex: */
01657 #define  CV_NEXT_GRAPH_EDGE( edge, vertex )                              \
01658      (assert((edge)->vtx[0] == (vertex) || (edge)->vtx[1] == (vertex)),  \
01659       (edge)->next[(edge)->vtx[1] == (vertex)])

01677 /* List of attributes: */
01678 typedef struct CvAttrList
01679 {
01680     const char** attr;         /* NULL-terminated array of (attribute_name,attribute_value) pairs. */
01681     struct CvAttrList* next;   /* Pointer to next chunk of the attributes list.                    */
01682 }
01683 CvAttrList;
01684 
01685 CV_INLINE CvAttrList cvAttrList( const char** attr CV_DEFAULT(NULL),
01686                                  CvAttrList* next CV_DEFAULT(NULL) )
01687 {
01688     CvAttrList l;
01689     l.attr = attr;
01690     l.next = next;
01691 
01692     return l;
01693 }

01750 /* Basic element of the file storage - scalar or collection: */
01751 typedef struct CvFileNode
01752 {
01753     int tag;
01754     struct CvTypeInfo* info; /* type information
01755             (only for user-defined object, for others it is 0) */
01756     union
01757     {
01758         double f; /* scalar floating-point number */
01759         int i;    /* scalar integer number */
01760         CvString str; /* text string */
01761         CvSeq* seq; /* sequence (ordered collection of file nodes) */
01762         CvFileNodeHash* map; /* map (collection of named file nodes) */
01763     } data;
01764 }
01765 CvFileNode;
